tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V2.1.3 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: [COLOR red]Renegades INFO[/COLOR] - Click for details and start times.
programme.desc: Here we will be posting special events and live sports for your viewing pleasure. Click for details and start times. Enjoy!(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt presents national and international news, plus entertainment and weather, with Naga Munchetty reporting from Windsor on the eve of the royal wedding.(n)

programme.title: Ill Gotten Gains
programme.desc: Merseyside Police execute multiple raids on properties across the Liverpool area, while officers in Wales track down organised crime gangs selling drugs out of suburban homes.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin visit more properties, featuring two in Wolverhampton and Greenford, west London, that need a lot of work, and one near Derby that the owners believe needs just minor improvements.(n)

programme.title: A1: Britain's Longest Road
programme.desc: A crash in rush hour leaves traffic officers tackling a potential fire risk, and a marathon mission sees Scotland's finest food ferried down the A1 to London. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Housing Enforcers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright visits an overcrowded property that is putting lives at risk, and conversations become heated on a street tackling anti-social behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning presents from Leominster, Herefordshire, where Gary Pe and John Cameron are the experts assisting the two sides. Plus, Anita show off pieces of pottery with a royal connection.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Amanda tries to help a man to grieve after losing his son, but concealing her own problems only succeeds in pushing him further away, while Karen helps James with his accommodation.(n)

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When Blake is called to investigate the murder of a retired carpenter, his only real suspect is a teenage boy discovered praying over the body and covered in blood.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a couple of childhood sweethearts find their ideal rural retreat in the Devon countryside with a generous £900,000 budget, and also visits a historic wool mill that was saved by the local community.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes: Wedding Special
programme.desc: Paul Ainsworth cooks a rustic royal dish with Michael Buerk, while Dr Annie Gray tells the story of an unlikely royal bride. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Ore Oduba in which contestants have to answer questions to get as far along a track as they can before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Wedding: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
programme.sub-title: The Royal Wedding: They're Getting Married in the Morning
programme.desc: Kirsty Young, Huw Edwards and Dermot O'Leary present the latest news ahead of tomorrow's ceremony at St George's Chapel, Windsor Castle, which will see American actress and humanitarian Meghan Markle marry Prince Harry. The presenters hear from some of the people who are playing key roles, finding out about their own preparations for the occasion. A team of reporters around the venue will also be on hand with updates, as crowds start to gather to claim the best vantage points.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Martin is furious about what Stacey and Hayley did, with his estranged wife's attempts to apologise getting her nowhere. Can the couple come back from this? Whitney and Halfway leave for Milton Keynes, and the Carters prepare for Prince Harry and Meghan's nuptials - although Linda is furious when Stuart turns up and breaks her favourite royal mug.(n)

programme.title: The Button
programme.desc: Game show set simultaneously in the houses of five UK families, as they tackle a number of fiendishly fun challenges requiring skill, determination and intellect from the comfort of their living rooms over the course of a day in the hope of securing cash prizes. Featuring the voice of Alex Horne.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Actor, comedian and Crystal Maze presenter Richard Ayoade takes over the reins of the satirical quiz, with stand-up Roisin Conaty and journalist and broadcaster Robert Peston joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.(n)

programme.title: Home from Home
programme.desc: Little Neil announces he has to make a scale model of a building of world significance as part of his homework. Neil tries to assist, but is easily distracted and while he is away at the pencil museum, Robert helps the youngster construct the Chrysler building. Distraught by this turn of events, Neil then tries to play catch-up, proposing they build a facsimile of the Empire State building. Meanwhile, Garth breaks into one of the lodges in an effort to ingratiate himself with Petra. Comedy, starring Johnny Vegas, Adam James and Niky Wardley.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by guests Emilia Clarke, who chats about her role in Solo: A Star Wars Story, Gloria Estefan, who discusses On Your Feet, a new show about her life and music, and Miriam Margolyes, who talks about joining the cast of Call the Midwife. Plus, Leon Bridges performs his new single Beyond, Graham reviews trending news stories and another bunch of intrepid audience members recount an anecdote from the dreaded red chair.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman, who aim to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Young, Welsh and Pretty Minted
programme.desc: New series. Cameras follow lucrative young entrepreneurs in Wales, including 22-year-old YouTube superstar The Gonth, who reveals the secret to making a six-figure income online. Plus, social influencer Erin who makes £900 every time she posts a photograph on Instagram, and 19-year-old Gabby who is behind a swanky collection of designer swimwear.(n)

programme.title: Bikes! North West 200 Highlights
programme.desc: Stephen Watson presents action from the annual motorcycle event, which is held on public roads running between Portstewart, Coleraine and Portrush. With analysis by Phillip McCallen.(n)

programme.title: The Blame Game
programme.desc: Angela Barnes joins regulars Neil Delamere, Colin Murphy, Jake O'Kane and Tim McGarry for the topical comedy panel show, waving the finger of blame at anybody and anything for the woes of the world.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman, who aim to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Young, Welsh and Pretty Minted
programme.desc: New series. Cameras follow lucrative young entrepreneurs in Wales, including 22-year-old YouTube superstar The Gonth, who reveals the secret to making a six-figure income online. Plus, social influencer Erin who makes £900 every time she posts a photograph on Instagram, and 19-year-old Gabby who is behind a swanky collection of designer swimwear.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts offer advice and tips on what to look out for in the world of animal and bird collectibles, with Philip Serrell reminiscing about his days as a livestock auctioneer. Anita Manning reveals what happens behind the scenes of a salesroom and presenter Paul Martin meets a sculptor with a passion for horses.(n)

programme.title: Ill Gotten Gains
programme.desc: Merseyside police execute multiple raids on properties across the Liverpool area, and a crime leads to a sailing yacht being sold off at a proceeds-of-crime auction.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes: Wedding Special
programme.desc: Michael Buerk helps Anna Haugh make a wedding cake fit for a modern royal couple and Paul Ainsworth takes a tour of Royal Windsor. Plus, the `London cure' method of smoking salmon.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce hosts the show from Floors Castle in south-east Scotland, and discovers the story of an American heiress who donated a collection of fine art, porcelain and furniture to the estate. Among the items brought in to be valued are a delicate Chinese lantern, a collection of jewellery and a rare book signed by JRR Tolkien.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country.(n)

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at £1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their attempt, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Aled Jones goes back to the 1930s as he hears from a woman whose father rose above his childhood disabilities but lived an adult life shrouded in secrecy.(n)

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In this episode, Alice Roberts joins archaeologists in the North as they uncover writing tablets, swords and domestic items left by Romans at Vindolanda during a time of British rebellion, before finding traces of a long lost monastery and pilgrimage site on the Scottish island of Iona. Meanwhile in the east of Scotland, a weapons hoard belonging to a wealthy Bronze Age warrior is unearthed.(n)

programme.title: Victorian Farm
programme.desc: The team receives help from a woodsman, a blacksmith and a basket-maker when the farm needs emergency repairs. Ruth Goodman tests traditional potions and remedies, while Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn employ Victorian-style pest control to protect the wheat crop from pheasants.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paula McElhinney may have early symptoms of Huntington's Disease, but it hasn't stopped her helping others, Her neighbours in Limavady, Northern Ireland, want to thank her, so presenter Paul Martin arranges a pop-up auction, and then reveals to Paula the fundraising is all for her.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and Paul Laidlaw's final trip in the 1960s Volvo sees them plot a course through Kent. Paul finds himself in Dover and hears about one plucky swimmer who believed bagpipes would help him across the English Channel, while Kate infiltrates a once top secret organisation for the afternoon to learn more about their history. The duo later head for an auction in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: Great CityGames Manchester: Great CityGames Manchester 2018
programme.desc: Live coverage from a purpose-built track in Deansgate, where the 10th staging of the annual event takes place. A number of stars from Team GB are expected to compete at this year's event, as they did last year when the likes of Holly Bradshaw, Greg Rutherford, Asha Philip, Jonnie Peacock and James Dasaolu all triumphed in their respective events.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Wales with Richard Parks
programme.desc: New series. The endurance athlete and former Welsh rugby international Richard Parks embarks on extreme adventures across Wales. In the first programme, Richard heads on a three-day, adrenaline-fuelled, wet and wild coastal expedition as he climbs, scrambles and swims the St David's Head Peninsula in Pembrokeshire.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don adds plants to give height and drama to his cottage garden borders, while Carol Klein's plant of the season is the delicate dog's tooth violet. Joe Swift travels to the Trellisick garden in Cornwall to meet a special garden volunteer and Adam Frost returns to Leicestershire to monitor the progress of the new-build garden.(n)

programme.title: The Bridge
programme.desc: Saga wants to return to work following her traumatic assault, but while Henrik wants to have her on the investigation, Lillian takes some convincing. Saga remains obsessed with finding Henrik's daughters, while he wonders if he will have to give in to the idea that they are no longer alive in order to finally move on. The investigation into Margrethe Thormod's murder continues, with suspicion falling on a radical left wing group and a refugee who has gone missing after being rejected for asylum. In Danish and Swedish.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: New series. The comedian returns with the programme in which he tries to make sense of the modern world, using a combination of stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction to dissect the week's biggest issues - with Sara Pascoe, Katherine Ryan, Mona Chalabi and a panel of guests on hand to take Frankie to task over his claims.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Being Blacker
programme.desc: Molly Dineen's documentary about Blacker Dread, a Jamaican-born reggae producer, businessman, father, son and pillar of the community in Brixton. The film focuses on a tumultuous time in his life as he deals with the death of his mother and the prospect of his first prison sentence.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts offer advice and tips on what to look out for in the world of animal and bird collectibles, with Philip Serrell reminiscing about his days as a livestock auctioneer. Anita Manning reveals what happens behind the scenes of a salesroom and presenter Paul Martin meets a sculptor with a passion for horses.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Aled Jones goes back to the 1930s as he hears from a woman whose father rose above his childhood disabilities but lived an adult life shrouded in secrecy.(n)

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In this episode, Alice Roberts joins archaeologists in the North as they uncover writing tablets, swords and domestic items left by Romans at Vindolanda during a time of British rebellion, before finding traces of a long lost monastery and pilgrimage site on the Scottish island of Iona. Meanwhile in the east of Scotland, a weapons hoard belonging to a wealthy Bronze Age warrior is unearthed.(n)

programme.title: Victorian Farm
programme.desc: The team receives help from a woodsman, a blacksmith and a basket-maker when the farm needs emergency repairs. Ruth Goodman tests traditional potions and remedies, while Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn employ Victorian-style pest control to protect the wheat crop from pheasants.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paula McElhinney may have early symptoms of Huntington's Disease, but it hasn't stopped her helping others, Her neighbours in Limavady, Northern Ireland, want to thank her, so presenter Paul Martin arranges a pop-up auction, and then reveals to Paula the fundraising is all for her.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and Paul Laidlaw's final trip in the 1960s Volvo sees them plot a course through Kent. Paul finds himself in Dover and hears about one plucky swimmer who believed bagpipes would help him across the English Channel, while Kate infiltrates a once top secret organisation for the afternoon to learn more about their history. The duo later head for an auction in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: Great CityGames Manchester: Great CityGames Manchester 2018
programme.desc: Live coverage from a purpose-built track in Deansgate, where the 10th staging of the annual event takes place. A number of stars from Team GB are expected to compete at this year's event, as they did last year when the likes of Holly Bradshaw, Greg Rutherford, Asha Philip, Jonnie Peacock and James Dasaolu all triumphed in their respective events.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Wales with Richard Parks
programme.desc: New series. The endurance athlete and former Welsh rugby international Richard Parks embarks on extreme adventures across Wales. In the first programme, Richard heads on a three-day, adrenaline-fuelled, wet and wild coastal expedition as he climbs, scrambles and swims the St David's Head Peninsula in Pembrokeshire.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don adds plants to give height and drama to his cottage garden borders, while Carol Klein's plant of the season is the delicate dog's tooth violet. Joe Swift travels to the Trellisick garden in Cornwall to meet a special garden volunteer and Adam Frost returns to Leicestershire to monitor the progress of the new-build garden.(n)

programme.title: The Bridge
programme.desc: Saga wants to return to work following her traumatic assault, but while Henrik wants to have her on the investigation, Lillian takes some convincing. Saga remains obsessed with finding Henrik's daughters, while he wonders if he will have to give in to the idea that they are no longer alive in order to finally move on. The investigation into Margrethe Thormod's murder continues, with suspicion falling on a radical left wing group and a refugee who has gone missing after being rejected for asylum. In Danish and Swedish.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: New series. The comedian returns with the programme in which he tries to make sense of the modern world, using a combination of stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction to dissect the week's biggest issues - with Sara Pascoe, Katherine Ryan, Mona Chalabi and a panel of guests on hand to take Frankie to task over his claims.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Being Blacker
programme.desc: Molly Dineen's documentary about Blacker Dread, a Jamaican-born reggae producer, businessman, father, son and pillar of the community in Brixton. The film focuses on a tumultuous time in his life as he deals with the death of his mother and the prospect of his first prison sentence.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts offer advice and tips on what to look out for in the world of animal and bird collectibles, with Philip Serrell reminiscing about his days as a livestock auctioneer. Anita Manning reveals what happens behind the scenes of a salesroom and presenter Paul Martin meets a sculptor with a passion for horses.(n)

programme.title: Ill Gotten Gains
programme.desc: Merseyside police execute multiple raids on properties across the Liverpool area, and a crime leads to a sailing yacht being sold off at a proceeds-of-crime auction.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes: Wedding Special
programme.desc: Michael Buerk helps Anna Haugh make a wedding cake fit for a modern royal couple and Paul Ainsworth takes a tour of Royal Windsor. Plus, the `London cure' method of smoking salmon.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce hosts the show from Floors Castle in south-east Scotland, and discovers the story of an American heiress who donated a collection of fine art, porcelain and furniture to the estate. Among the items brought in to be valued are a delicate Chinese lantern, a collection of jewellery and a rare book signed by JRR Tolkien.(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: How a fleet of truckers transport the valuable cargo of timber from the Galloway Forest Park to mills north and south of the border. An explosion is planned at a forest quarry to produce rock for a new road masterminded by Forestry Engineer Elaine McClymont, but before it can be given the go-ahead, Environment Officer Gareth Ventress needs to check for any pine marten activity in the area.(n)

programme.title: Big Love
programme.desc: The story of James and Phil Lusted from north Wales, who have a rare form of dwarfism and are 3ft 7 and 3ft respectively. The film reveals how they managed to find love with women of average height, with both of them engaged to be married. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: Scrum V Live
programme.desc: Glasgow Warriors v Scarlets (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from the PRO14 play-off semi-final from Scotstoun Stadium. Scarlets recorded a convincing 43-8 victory over Cheetahs in the previous round, but the Warriors are likely to be a much tougher proposition given they ended the regular season with the best record in the competition.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: A journey around some of the most dramatic coastlines in Europe, uncovering the stories behind how these landscapes have shaped history.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: A lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen. Presented by Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford.(n)

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: With Dickie Arbiter, television and radio commentator on the British Royal Family, who discusses tomorrow's wedding between Prince Harry and Meghan Markle.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: The case of 17-year-old Shafilea Ahmed, who was brutally murdered by her parents Iftikhar and Farzana in Warrington in September 2003. Friends of both Shafilea and her sister Mevish give exclusive interviews recalling the part they played in helping bring her parents to justice.(n)

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public in Leigh, Greater Manchester, sort the treasures from their trash. A Chinese sauce boat catches the eye of dealer Jo Brayshaw, while Mark Stevens smells the prospect of a profit in the shape of some perfume bottles. Meanwhile, James Layte's attention is diverted towards a historic Almanac.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Will, Kate, Harry and Megan pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ross' true intentions are revealed, while the community reels from devastating news as the police descends on the village.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Rana is horrified to see Zeedan taking photos of Kate and Sophie through a pub window, and a puzzled Liz wonders why Ali lied about his Weatherfield placement. Meanwhile, Kevin and Tyrone interview Abi for the mechanic's job.(n)

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Liz Bonnin travel the length and breadth of Britain to discover the countryside's hidden gems, natural wonders and great escapes. Ben heads out on a tour of the stunning Isles of Scilly with his guide Colin Taylor, the police sergeant in charge of this little part of the world, while Liz Bonnin is on the Dorset coast on to view some of the millions of birds that travel thousands of miles to reach these shores each spring.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sophie and Kate have a close encounter with some abusive lads, and when one of them later attacks Kate, Zeedan knocks him unconscious. Meanwhile, Robert suffers chest pains, and Eileen is unnerved when she starts receiving silent phone calls.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: The city's gun buy-back programme is robbed, and the team goes on a hunt for those responsible, while Murtaugh walks on thin ice with Trish, Riggs finds an unlikely friend in Ruthie, and Captain Avery is reunited with a college 'frenemy' who has key information about the case.(n)

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness re-create James Cameron's 1991 sci-fi blockbuster Terminator 2: Judgment Day. The comic duo are joined by an all-star cast including Jaime Winstone, Rick Astley and Hank Osasuna to tell the story of a cyborg that is sent back in time to protect the future saviour of the human race from a shape-changing assassin. Terminator 2: Judgment Day follows after the news.(n)

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Singer and I'm a Celebrity winner Kian Egan, TV presenter Christine Bleakley and Celebrity Squares host Warwick Davis make up this week's panel as Keith Lemon noses around the homes of mystery stars. Using clues highlighted along each tour, and with the help of the studio audience, the guests try to work out which famous faces have handed over their house keys to the Celebrity Juice funnyman.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Adrian Chiles joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: Tommy decides to win Alissa back and goes off to rent a scary film - but somehow Dick and Strudwick become convinced the pair have eloped and set off in hot pursuit.(n)

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: Dick and Sally boast about their prowess in the bedroom, prompting a sudden attraction between Don and Mary. Comedy, starring John Lithgow, Jane Curtin, Kristen Johnston and French Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray enlists his mother's help to reassure Ally, who is afraid to sleep in her own room because she is convinced it becomes the haunt of monsters once the lights go out. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie is thrilled to learn that Robert's new girlfriend is a virgin, so Ray tries to convince her that Debra is a `good girl' too, leading to a surprising revelation from Marie and Frank.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Self-important `corkmaster' Niles arranges a boycott of Frasier's new radio show on wine appreciation, while Martin struggles to escape the powerful clutches of his new physiotherapist - until he samples her delicious cooking. Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne breezes back into Niles's life, sparking off an argument and casting a shadow over his chances of finding romantic fulfilment. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne tries to convince Niles she is psychic, while Frasier's former college professor and mentor comes to visit, and immediately forms a romantic attachment with Roz. Comedy, guest starring Rene Auberjonois (Star Trek: Deep Space Nine), with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yanni's in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasn't allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peter's family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Miller, CEO of the Larry H Miller Group of Companies and co-owner of National Basketball Association team the Utah Jazz, goes undercover. Since his dad died he has made many changes to the organisation, and posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition to win a dream job, he works among his own staff to see if his father's legacy still lives on.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: David Bull and Kirsty Duffy help retired couple Tim and Sue find their forever home together in Somerset, searching both coastal and countryside properties on a budget of £390,000.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield, boss Dan Hatfield and his sister Cherise try to negotiate a deal on a tuk-tuk, and cobbler Peter is looking for a quick cash deal on some designer shoes and an antique clock. Meanwhile, at Pickwick pawnbrokers in London, Nathan Finch secures deals on a classic silver Clipper caravan, some war memorabilia and several designer luxury bags.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with psychologist Linda Papadopoulos joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Lesley and Phil Ward from north Wales plan to embark on the next chapter of their lives, and hope a full-time move to La Marina Alta on the Costa Blanca in Spain. The pair have a £125,000 budget in mind, and Scarlette Douglas is on hand to show them five properties that might fit the bill, including a home by the beach and a townhouse.(n)

programme.title: The £100k Drop
programme.desc: Sam and Shurma, a married couple from Whitley Bay, and mother and daughter Sarah and Hazel from Chigwell start off with £100,000 and must avoid wrong answers to maximise their win.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: As the B&B owners meet for the final time, Paul Martin and Jayne Kirk from The Forest Country House want to get to the bottom of Nadia's low scores.(n)

programme.title: Buy It Now
programme.desc: Mum Melanie has an idea to help parents get more sleep, while friends Jay and Barney have a solution to a problem they believe many men suffer from.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: School bully Jimbo orders Bart to entertain his girlfriend Shauna, so he takes her to the cinema. But before he knows it, he's fallen for the girl and chaperoning turns to canoodling. Homer needs to shift the pounds but it's a struggle for him to leave his beloved sofa - until a treadmill with a built-in TV provides all the motivation he needs.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Glenn gives Grace a hard time and tells her to pull herself together, but he may have taken things one step too far when she is reduced to tears.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Reporter Sahar Zand and director Alicia Arce investigate how the £MeToo campaign has taken off in India's film industry, talking to some of the country's leading actresses, who are speaking out against assault, sexual harassment and rape. In a country where attitudes to women are changing, but where many people still hold conservative views about the role of women, can the £MeToo movement really gain momentum?(n)

programme.title: Our Wildest Dreams
programme.desc: Lynn and Richard and their two young daughters Emily and Yvaine are a `food-bank family' from Bedfordshire, desperately unhappy with their quality of life in the UK. They pack up their belongings in a horsebox and head for a remote part of central Portugal, to follow their dream off living off-grid, being completely self-sufficient and, for the first time, escape the pressures of living on the breadline. They face immediate physical and emotional challenges, such as camping on an unsuitable plot of land, wild summer storms and forest fires, and Richard's discovery that he's not quite the builder he thought he was. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Quiz show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mickey Webb, now working with the National Crime Squad, returns to Sun Hill and tells Jack he suspects Neil has ensured the silence of a key witness in a major money laundering trial. Alan Kennedy sets a trap for Samantha, luring her to a deserted warehouse and holding her at knifepoint, while Ramani's suspicions about Margaret grow after a witness statement goes missing.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: A herd of cows goes rogue and turns on its stockman, leaving him with life threatening injuries. The paramedics of the Yorkshire Air Ambulance also fall victim to an elaborate hoax after a climber who claims to have fallen off a cliff face turns out to be unhurt.(n)

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies

programme.title: A Sharp Intake of Breath
programme.desc: Peter is reunited with an old friend from his army days, who invites him and Sheila to come and stay with him at his country retreat.(n)

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: Following a particularly dismal Christmas holiday, Gary desperately tries to find a way of seeing in the New Year with both Yvonne and Phoebe - a situation made worse by his wartime landlady's threat to chuck him out after a night of illicit passion. Time-travelling comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst, Dervla Kirwan and Michelle Holmes.(n)

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie puts Marlene under pressure to fit in with the locals, so she decides to take up cookery - an idea that does not go down well with her family. She orders her husband to pick blackberries for a pie, causing him to inadvertently trespass on the land of his anti-English neighbour. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Nora dons a revealing outfit for a church pageant and is dared by Ivy to call Compo's bluff and present herself on his doorstep. Unfortunately, the shock proves too much for him and he is raced to hospital. Alas, he failed to make it through, presenting his friends with a dilemma on how best to commemorate him. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star in a special instalment of Roy Clarke's comedy, marking the departure of Bill Owen's character from the series.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: As preparations get under way for Compo's funeral, Clegg is amazed to be given a letter written by the old rascal with strict instructions that it should only be opened in event of his death. Peter Sallis, Kathy Staff and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo's funeral day arrives, and emotions run high as Clegg and Truly face the saddest moment of their lives. Elsewhere, others have problems deciding what to wear, and Howard suddenly finds himself torn between three demanding females. Long-running comedy starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: You Rang, M'Lord
programme.desc: Lady Lavender instructs her solicitor to give Ivy her shares from the Union Jack Rubber Company and James is tortured by thoughts of Miss Poppy. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.(n)

programme.title: Are You Being Served
programme.desc: The staff suggest holding a fashion show during a think tank set up to boost falling sales, and agree to model the clothes themselves. Comedy, starring John Inman and Mollie Sugden.(n)

programme.desc: When Spike's sing-along routines are considered to have failed, Jeffrey treats the campers to a classical music recital using his collection of gramophone records. programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: First episode of Richard Curtis's comedy, starring Dawn French as the new vicar of a sleepy English village. Her arrival causes consternation among the locals - particularly stuffy councillor David Horton, who vows to have her ejected at all costs. Gary Waldhorn, James Fleet and Emma Chambers co-star.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Part two of two. After a whirlwind romance with handsome newcomer Harry, Geraldine swaps her dog collar and cassock for a wedding dress, and hurriedly makes preparations for the big day. But the vicar she has chosen for the service seems a little too fond of her, while the villagers have waited until the last minute to suggest their ideas. The first is a skydiving wedding - the second is something far, far worse. Keeley Hawes and Hugh Bonneville guest star in the last-ever episode of the comedy, alongside Dawn French, Emma Chambers, Roger Lloyd Pack, James Fleet, Gary Waldhorn, Trevor Peacock and John Bluthal.(n)

programme.desc: A woman is trapped in the wreckage of her car after spinning across six lanes of a dual carriageway, and an electrical fire threatens the cables and pipes beneath a busy road.(n)

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: An alternative USA where technology is banned spells trouble for Rimmer and Kryten, and the Dwarfers infiltrate the tech-savvy underground to try to bring down the regime.(n)

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: When the Dwarfers investigate a crashed ship at the bottom of an ocean moon, Lister and Cat become trapped together and Lister's nightmare begins.(n)

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister has his kidneys removed following an altercation with a deranged droid and the only solution is to ask Cat, the most selfish creature in the universe, to give him one of his.(n)

programme.desc: An extended 2013 version of the satirical current affairs quiz. Comedian David Mitchell is in the host's chair, poking fun at the week's headlines along with old hands Paul Merton and Ian Hislop. Their guests on the first show are Channel 4 news presenter Cathy Newman and broadcaster Danny Baker.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy bargains galore.(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Last-ever episode of the medical comedy. Cole's brush with cancer inspires him to become a surgeon, but Turk is reluctant to act as the preppy intern's new mentor. Meanwhile, a large hole in the wall separating their two rooms gives Drew and Denise a taste of what living together would be like, and Lucy plans a tribute for the families of the cadavers she has been dissecting during her first term at medical school. Dave Franco, Donald Faison and Kerry Bishe star.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Girl Who Hits Joey
programme.desc: Ross makes a bad impression on his new neighbours, and Monica piles the pressure on Chandler, demanding more commitment than he feels able to give. Joey's latest girlfriend proves a little too fiery - but he is afraid to end their relationship.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey wonders why he has started dreaming about dating Monica, while Phoebe finds a police badge at Central Perk and decides to take the law into her own hands.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Rachel's Inadvertent Kiss
programme.desc: Rachel is interviewed for her dream job, but makes the mistake of inadvertently kissing her prospective employer. Meanwhile, Monica competes with Phoebe in the relationship stakes.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.sub-title: Red Light on the Wedding Night
programme.desc: During a wild hen party thrown by Sookie, Lorelai makes an impulsive phone call to Rory's dad Christopher and sadly realises that Max is not the man for her after all. Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel star.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel starts taking regular cigarette breaks to ingratiate herself with new boss Kim and colleague Nancy, even though she does not smoke, while Joey competes with Ross's son for a role in a TV commercial. Comedy, guest starring Joanna Gleason (Boogie Nights).(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Can't Flirt
programme.desc: Joey tells everyone about his upcoming TV appearance, little anticipating the surprise awaiting him, and Ross flirts with a pizza-delivery woman, but leaves her decidedly unimpressed.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a ride in a police car, until the sound of a gunshot causes them to fear for their lives. Meanwhile, Rachel accidentally listens to a telephone message to Ross from Emily. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and David Schwimmer.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe learns Gary plans to ask her to move in with him, but fears it is too early in their relationship for such a commitment, and asks Chandler to help her change his mind. While the rest of the gang become obsessed with playing a game of catch. Guest starring Michael Rapaport, with Lisa Kudrow and Matthew Perry.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr and Q look back at memorable moments from the hidden camera show.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys team up to work at a beauty store, coerce strangers into translating text messages written in Spanish, and do another round of Don't I Know You? at the mall.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One That Could Have Been - Part Two
programme.desc: The second episode showing what could have happened to the gang members had their lives taken different paths. Carol and Ross decide to spice up their marriage, and Rachel catches Barry being unfaithful. Comedy, with David Schwimmer and Jennifer Aniston.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler's home-made gift for Monica lands him in trouble. Joey hires a lookalike to help him participate in a medical study, and Ross demonstrates martial arts to Rachel and Phoebe. Comedy, starring Matthew Perry and Courteney Cox.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Dates a Student
programme.desc: A fire leaves Rachel and Phoebe homeless, forcing them to impose on their pals' hospitality. Meanwhile, Chandler gives Joey career advice, and Ross gets into trouble for dating a student. Comedy, with Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross's girlfriend goes on a wild weekend away, leaving him to worry about what she is getting up to. Rachel longs for a date and Joey's fridge breaks down.(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.sub-title: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
programme.desc: Will accompanies a pregnant sports writer to a basketball game, but things take an unexpected turn when she goes into labour in the car park. Comedy, with Will Smith and guest star Vanessa Williams.(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Carlton's girlfriend dumps him for Will, and Philip and Vivian decide they want the sex of their baby kept secret. Will Smith stars.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Mac and CHEESE
programme.desc: Joey auditions for a major TV show about a man and his crime-fighting robot, but Chandler almost ruins everything. With clips from earlier episodes, starring Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, David Schwimmer, Matthew Perry and Matt LeBlanc.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Meets Elizabeth's Dad
programme.desc: Ross nervously prepares to meet Elizabeth's dad for the first time and Phoebe decides to write a book about Monica and Chandler. Joey is threatened with dismissal for insulting the operator of the robot alongside which he is due to star in his latest role. Guest starring Bruce Willis.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Paul's the Man
programme.desc: Elizabeth sneaks away with Ross to her grandmother's cabin for a romantic weekend, unaware her dad and Rachel have had exactly the same idea. American comedy, guest starring Bruce Willis.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler makes the mistake of asking Phoebe to help him choose an engagement ring for Monica, while Rachel urges Paul to open up and reveal his emotions but he ends up revealing too much. Guest starring Bruce Willis.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Proposal - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Chandler's plans for a romantic proposal are ruined by Richard's reappearance. Ross gets an uncomfortable reminder of his girlfriend's immaturity, while Joey unwittingly buys a boat at an auction. Comedy, starring Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Proposal - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Monica is left reeling by Richard's proposal, which puts pressure on a nervous Chandler to bite the bullet and suggest she marry him instead. Comedy, guest starring Tom Selleck, with Courteney Cox and Matthew Perry.(n)

programme.desc: Jimmy Carr and Katherine Ryan host the game show that puts couples to the test, with Ellis and Jake judging all kinds of faces for the chance to win thousands of pounds.(n)

programme.title: Bad Robots
programme.desc: Some guest lecturers receive an unexpected internet history from their new web browser, while border control keeps the Isle of Wight safe as day-trippers are interrogated until breaking-point. Elsewhere, people cannot believe their ears with the Hear 2 Stay automated hearing test machine, and Tezcorp radio is back with a new favourite song.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre: Live & Laughing
programme.desc: Stand-up comedy performed in front of a sell-out crowd at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The show features humorous observations on becoming a father, life on the road, and the `man drawer' in every house, where males keep those essential items they are sure they will need again.(n)

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.sub-title: As I Walk Through the Alley of the Shadow of Ramps
programme.desc: Louise schemes to win back the Belchers' turf when a malicious juice-truck owner tries to set up shop in their alley. Linda learns she cannot always run to her sister's defence.(n)

programme.title: Bordertown
programme.desc: Bud tries to be more successful than Ernesto, but unwittingly ends up as the inside man for drug kingpin Pablo Barracuda.(n)

programme.title: Nathan for You
programme.desc: Nathan sets up a fake film shoot in an effort to boost sales at a Hollywood souvenir shop, but he soon discovers that he may have committed fraud.(n)

programme.desc: After his surgery, Jake's co-workers butter him up in the hopes that he will share his prescription painkillers with them, and Matt is plagued by visions of a ghost.(n)

programme.title: Sea Patrol
programme.desc: The team encounters the disreputable skipper of an illegal fishing vessel, and after being bitten by the rogue's dog, panicky RO Robert takes too many sleeping pills on the Hammersley, and falls overboard.(n)

programme.title: Sea Patrol
programme.desc: After discovering a metal container of human body parts, followed by a vessel found carrying well looked after people who have all had blood tests, Swain realises the passengers are unwitting victims of the lucrative illegal organ trade.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate the murder of memoir writer Sweetie Ness. Clues initially lead them to suspect his stalker, agent and a groupie, but after digging deeper into the victim's past, they begin to consider the possibility he was not who he claimed to be.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman's murder leads Lupo and Bernard to learn she was secretly in conflict with her husband, going against his desire that their family lead an environmentally friendly life. The case is complicated further when a dead passenger and drugs turn up in the car she was using, with the complexity continuing in the courtroom as Cutter suspects someone has been tampering with evidence. Guest starring Ned Beatty (Deliverance) and Sherry Stringfield (ER).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate when lawyers Fred and Lizzy Bellamy are found murdered in their sleep. The case leads them to two couples who are in the process of adopting children from Haiti, but the detectives uncover signs of abuse that point to a human-trafficking ring.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate when a plaintiff involved in a high-profile lawsuit against airline Pan World is found dead in his car. The detectives soon discover the case had been delayed after the presiding judge was murdered and the clues lead to a lawyer willing to do anything for money.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine major is found dead in an underground maintenance room, having scratched out one of his own eyes - and the presence of a webcam suggests someone watched him die. The team investigates with the help of Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents try to track down an arms dealer who has the launch codes for the Navy's encrypted satellite defence system and is offering them to the highest bidder. In an attempt to win the confidence of the buyer, Ducky poses as an ageing Englishman trying to sell the information. Guest starring Armand Assante, with David McCallum and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A nuclear power plant inspector suffers radiation poisoning, forcing the team to consider the possibility that a foreign power deliberately targeted him. As the others investigate, Ziva spends time with the ailing victim - and begins to realise she is developing feelings for him. Drama, guest starring Matthew Marsden, with Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A supposedly dead marine suddenly regains consciousness on the autopsy table, leaving the team struggling to solve the mystery of how he came to be in such a strange predicament. Investigations reveal he had recently been on a trip to Baghdad - and uncover an unexpected link to Gibbs' past. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee feels the pressure as the team investigates a double murder that appears to be inspired by his still unpublished new novel. His sense of guilt is compounded by the realisation that one of his colleagues could become the killer's third target. American drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service, starring Sean Murray and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Jenny Shepard tries to solve the murder of an underworld source who was prepared to give information on the activities of arms dealer La Grenouille. Unfortunately her behaviour becomes increasingly obsessive as the case proceeds, leaving Gibbs wondering if her judgement is being clouded by a personal motivation. Starring Lauren Holly and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Trial by Jury
programme.desc: First episode of the legal drama spin-off, focusing on the workings of the US judicial system. Assistant district attorney Tracey Kibre is assigned the case of a Broadway actress's murder. Theatre producer Kurt Lascher is the prime suspect, who knows the police have been unable to find physical evidence at the crime scene - or even a body. Starring Bebe Neuwirth, Amy Carlson and Kirk Acevedo.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Fin investigates a man's claim that his sister was gang raped.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A high-school sex party sparks a vaccination debate when those involved contract the measles. Meanwhile, Noah suffers another health scare.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Police from Chicago arrive and team up with the squad to track down a suspect they had to release earlier when a crime in their city resembles a decade-old New York City case. Starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates a video games company when one of its testers is found dead. While the victim appears to have been killed in a car crash, it transpires he was murdered beforehand - and has had his foot cut off to conceal the cause of death. A former porn star who was involved in a previous case comes looking for protection from a former producer who is trying to blackmail her. Guest starring Kerr Smith (Dawson's Creek) and professional skateboarder Tony Hawk.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio investigates the deaths of two tax inspectors who were killed on the same day - one shot in his car and the other gunned down by the owner of a yacht that he was trying to repossess. Meanwhile, Ryan causes friction by taking credit for work that Delko did in the field. Willie Garson (Sex and the City) and Zac Efron (High School Musical) guest star.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to buy bargains galore at home.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: The ship stalls in a plasma cloud during a desperate attempt to escape pursuing Vidiian vessels, causing a chain of technical malfunctions. In the middle of the chaos, Captain Janeway makes a remarkable discovery and takes an important step - with the lives of the crew depending on her actions.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: Tuvok crash-lands his shuttle on a haven for an alien race that shuns contact with outsiders, and it is not long before he is forced to protect three colonist children from a monster. Sci-fi drama, starring Tim Russ.(n)

programme.title: Atlantis
programme.desc: The trio are hunting in the mountains when they stumble across an abandoned baby, and Jason insists they take it back to the city against his friends' advice. Sure enough, his charitable act has far-reaching consequences when they find themselves embroiled in a web of secrets and lies, with their own lives on the line - as well as that of the infant's. Fantasy drama, guest starring Donald Sumpter (Game of Thrones' Maester Luwin).(n)

programme.title: Grimm's Snow White
programme.desc: A benevolent king is killed by monstrous giant reptiles, placing the crown in the hands of his cruel second wife. The new queen realises her dead husband's daughter is a threat to her reign and plots to have her killed, forcing the princess to flee for her life into a dark and mysterious forest. Fantasy adventure, starring Eliza Bennett, Jane March and Jamie Thomas King.(n)

programme.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
programme.desc: Xander and Cordelia have a close encounter with a werewolf. Since this monster is an innocent human by day, Buffy plans to capture it alive, but a big game hunter is determined to kill the beast for its valuable pelt. Xander sets out to uncover the werewolf's human identity, while Willow wonders where her relationship with Oz is going. Supernatural adventure, with Sarah Michelle Gellar.(n)

programme.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
programme.desc: A humiliated Xander seeks revenge on Cordelia for spurning him - but makes the mistake of involving Amy in his plan, and soon finds himself pursued by every woman in Sunnydale except the one he wants. Meanwhile, Buffy is warned that Valentine's Day may signal a violent change in Angel's behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A Ferengi captain plots revenge on Picard for the untimely death of his son, accusing the Starfleet officer of destroying an innocent vessel commanded by his son, and forcing him to relive an unpleasant part event. Sci-fi drama, starring Patrick Stewart and Frank Corsentino.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The capricious Q offers Riker god-like powers and a chance to become a member of the Continuum. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jonathan Frakes and John de Lancie.(n)

programme.title: Atlantis
programme.desc: A night-time messenger brings news from outside the city for Ariadne, who calls on Jason and his friends to help guide her to its source. But leaving without raising the Queen's suspicions seems like an impossible task - especially when it turns out the one who has written is Therus, Ariadne's exiled brother. As Heptarian and the King's guards close in on his hiding place, Ariadne must decide where her loyalties lie - in Atlantis or with her royal sibling. Mark Addy, Jack Donnelly and Aiysha Hart star.(n)

programme.title: Who Am I
programme.desc: As a hacker's intrusions become more daring, he finds himself the object of increasing interest from the authorities. Mystery drama, starring Tom Schilling, Elyas M'Barek and Hannah Herzsprung.(n)

programme.title: Siren
programme.desc: As the military enter a state of high alert, Chris escapes the facility - but he is not the only one to make it out. Drama, starring Alex Roe and Eline Powell.(n)

programme.desc: Walden and Alan work together to plan a bachelor party to remember for Marty after he pops the question to Evelyn. However, things take a turn for the worse when he suddenly calls off the wedding. Comedy, starring Ashton Kutcher and Jon Cryer.(n)

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Jonah tries to help Mateo avoid claiming compensation when he is injured, in case his immigration status is revealed. Amy tries to persuade everyone that she likes Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Hall Pass
programme.desc: Two restless married men strike a deal with their wives - they will all take a one-week break from their marriages and act like they are single. However, they find getting back into the life of a swinging bachelor harder than expected, while the thought of how their wives are spending the week proves a constant worry. Comedy, starring Owen Wilson, Jason Sudeikis, Jenna Fischer and Christina Applegate.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Colonel and Joan Maltravers host a dinner party to celebrate their son's return from Kenya but the meal is disrupted by an armed robbery. David gives chase to the thief and becomes a local hero - much to the exasperation of Bernie. Liz has a difficult decision to make after receiving an exciting offer from Ben. Guest starring Simon Williams, his wife Lucy Fleming and their son Tam Williams.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Goodwin comes to the aid of a man brought in with a leg injury which his friend claims was sustained in an agricultural accident, but it soon emerges he is actually suffering a gunshot wound - prompting his panic-stricken acquaintance to pull a revolver on the hospital staff. Meanwhile, Ormerod helps fossil collectors hurt in a landslide, Matron tries to convince Sister Brigid to return to work and student nurse Samantha Beaumont is less than impressed at the offer of a date with Alun Morris. Medical drama, starring Paul Fox, Tony Pitts, Denis Lill, Robert Daws and Wendy Craig.(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Gruff detective Jack Frost's plans for a quiet weekend are disrupted by the gruesome discovery of an unidentified body floating in the river. However, soon after he has begun the investigation, he is forced to apply his deductive skills to a separate case involving an act of violence during a football match which left a player in a coma. Crime drama, starring David Jason, Larry Lamb, Bruce Alexander, Lindy Whiteford and Berwick Kaler.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.sub-title: All the Fun of the Fair
programme.desc: The residents are pleased when a fair comes to Elsinby, but Jeffrey and Samantha have their work cut out when the waltzer operator becomes trapped in the ride's mechanism. He's rushed to the hospital, where Mr Rose operates, and reveals his father has been suffering dizzy spells recently. A concerned Jeffrey heads back to the fairground, but he's too late to prevent disaster. Meanwhile, Ken hatches a dubious money-making scheme and Jill is forced to confront a patient's wife. Paul Fox, Anna Madeley and Amy Robbins star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police investigate the murder of an ex-army recluse and archaeological enthusiast and suspect a building dispute could provide a motive, while Dennis asks Liz for advice when he begins to notice a change in Jenny's behaviour. Vernon decides to play Cupid on behalf of his relative Gareth and sets him up on a blind date with Rosie, but does not count on the mechanic having another admirer. Rural drama starring Duncan Bell, Aislin McGuckin and Vanessa Hehir.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth is summoned when Colin Race is distracted from an investigation into a spy ring by the discovery of a murder victim surrounded by stopped clocks. The body was found at the home of blind former teacher Millicent Pebmarsh, but when a second death is reported, Poirot realises the man was killed elsewhere and brought to the scene, though the neighbours prove unhelpful eyewitnesses. Mystery, starring David Suchet, Anna Massey, Jaime Winstone, Lesley Sharp, Phil Daniels, Geoffrey Palmer and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Brief Encounters
programme.desc: Going against the wishes of her family, married mother-of-one Steph makes a life-changing decision to become an Ann Summers demonstrator and run parties selling exotic lingerie. She enlists the help of her new friend Nita and persuades well-to-do acquaintance Pauline to host an evening, but fears it might not really be the right crowd to sell to. Drama set in Sheffield in 1982, starring Sophie Rundle, Penelope Wilton, Angela Griffin and Sharon Rooney.(n)

programme.title: Brief Encounters

programme.title: Quincy ME

Jessica Walter guest stars, with Jack Klugman and John S Ragin.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur is held hostage by former friend Frankie Connor, who is now a prisoner on the run and desperate to know whether his wife is having an affair with Italian restaurateur Luigi. Final episode of the light-hearted drama, starring George Cole, Gary Webster and Glynn Edwards.(n)

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: Regan uses a criminal's abandoned dog as bait to lure his remorseful owner back into the country from France. However, associates of the villain spirit the hound away from its pound and a race begins as to who can locate the dog first. Alfred Marks, Brian Glover and Brian Wilde guest star, with John Thaw and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Miss King finds herself in a time warp while visiting an antique shop waking up in the room apparently 50 years earlier and addressed as Pandora. John Laurie (Dad's Army) guest stars, with Linda Thorson and Patrick Macnee.(n)

programme.title: Ironside
programme.desc: An old friend of Eve worries about his nephew's involvement in the manufacture of drugs. Raymond Burr stars.(n)

programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present coverage of the second day of the Dante Festival, featuring races at 2.20, 2.55, 3.30 and 4.05. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Johnny Murtagh, reports by Rishi Persad and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.(n)

programme.desc: Scott Cozens and Sheldon Smithens peruse a showroom of antique cars and jukeboxes, and meet a barber who drives a hard bargain.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys come across a set of keys to Al Capone's jail cell and one of the most sought after video game collectibles in the world, and also discover one of the Old Man's secrets.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team examines a collection of trainers with a $1million price tag, as well as a rare timepiece and a set of vintage handcuffs.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In an earlier investigation, Jeremy Wade was propelled into an Indian river by a goonch catfish as big as himself, yet managed to land the rare beast after an epic battle. Ten years on, Jeremy hears a report from neighbouring Nepal of a mysterious attack that sounds strangely familiar - a lone fisherman on a mountain river dragged off his feet and into the water by an unseen creature. The extreme angler contemplates whether the original river monster could be back, and sets off to find out.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Car Crash Britain: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston narrates the documentary featuring another selection of real-life incidents captured by people on their personal cameras. Highlights include a man who nearly gets taken out by an unsecured load on a van, road rage incidents and a motorist taking impromptu lessons in aquaplaning after a terrifying incident on a wet motorway.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Amnesiac rogue assassin Jason Bourne's long-buried memories are reawakened by a British journalist researching the secret organisation that was responsible for transforming him into a killing machine. Meanwhile, a ruthless CIA director becomes convinced Bourne is still a security risk, and plans to dispose of him once and for all. Third instalment of the spy thriller series, directed by Paul Greengrass and starring Matt Damon, Joan Allen, Julia Stiles, David Strathairn, Paddy Considine, Scott Glenn and Albert Finney.(n)

programme.title: Posh Neighbours at War
programme.desc: Documentary looking at disputes between residents in upmarket areas of London. Zipporah Lisle Mainwaring hit the headlines worldwide for painting her exclusive Kensington mews in bright red stripes, which came in the midst of an ongoing legal argument about her plans to turn this two-storey property into a dream home, complete with pool and cinema. The programme also hears from author Rachel Johnson, sister of London mayor Boris, who is one of the most outspoken Notting Hill residents on the horrors of living next door to a basement build.(n)

programme.title: How to Look Good Naked
programme.desc: Stylist Gok Wan comes to the aid of Cindy, a beleaguered 40-year-old mother-of-three who spends so much time running around after her children she has forgotten to take care of herself. He encourages her to get rid of her baggy clothes and inject some confidence into her life.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Millionaire
programme.desc: Property developer Rob Lloyd leaves his home in rural Cheshire to go undercover in Belfast, Northern Ireland, a city struggling to recover after three decades of unrest. From his base in the Shankill Road - where one of the Troubles' most notorious bombings took place in 1993 - Lloyd learns at first hand the personal cost of the conflict which tore apart the community. He sees how the residents are now rebuilding their lives, from a local boxing club to a housing project in Ardoyne, helping him to decide where to donate his money.(n)

programme.title: Forced Marriage Cops
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hidden world of forced marriages as the Greater Manchester Police tries to protect the victims and bring the perpetrators to justice. The programme captures the moments when girls escape from their parents and families, and follows the public protection teams as they investigate the biggest case they have ever seen.(n)

programme.title: Conspiracy of Hearts
programme.desc: A group of courageous Italian nuns risks everything during the Second World War. Deciding they cannot stand by and do nothing, the sisters begin smuggling Jewish children out of a German internment camp and transporting them to safety - but Nazi troops look set to discover the dangerous secret. Drama, starring Lilli Palmer, Sylvia Syms, Yvonne Mitchell, Ronald Lewis and Albert Lieven.(n)

programme.title: The Astonished Heart
programme.desc: A married psychiatrist falls for another woman - an old schoolfriend of his wife - leading to disaster for all concerned. Drama written by and starring Noel Coward, with Celia Johnson, Margaret Leighton and Joyce Carey.(n)

programme.desc: News headlines, travel, weather and debate from across the capital.(n)

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News headlines, travel, weather and debate from across the capital.(n)

programme.title: Prince Harry: Frontline Afghanistan
programme.desc: Documentary following Prince Harry on his Army tour of Afghanistan, which came to an end in January. The film offers an insight into his deployment as an Apache attack helicopter gunner, and the 28-year-old, who was on his second military visit to the country, also talks about his experiences. Presented by Richard Bacon.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Photos of the Duke And Duchess of Windsor
programme.desc: Documentary about the relationship between Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson, which led to the king's abdication.(n)

programme.title: Me and You and Everyone We Know
programme.desc: A shoe salesman recovering from the break-up of his marriage encounters an eccentric artist and taxi driver, but remains uncertain about how to respond to her romantic advances. Meanwhile, his two sons are forming unusual relationships of their own, as teenager Peter offers local girls his sexual services and seven-year-old Robby develops an online romance with a stranger. Drama, starring John Hawkes and Miranda July.(n)

programme.title: London Live Sessions

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Life on Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the multiplicity of mammals on the planet and how they became the dominant class of the world.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.(n)

programme.title: How Earth Made Us
programme.desc: Having documented the planetary forces that have shaped the development of civilisations, Iain Stewart discovers how this relationship has been reciprocated. He examines how the advent of farming prevented the world from slipping into a new ice age, and demonstrates why humanity unwittingly caused a catastrophic mudslide in Indonesia.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: A team searches a 100-year-old dig site to find the remains of a 73-million-year-old armoured dinosaur, while a paleontologist couple tries to airlift a 4,000kg skeleton.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores secret paths around the shores of the British Isles. Nick Crane heads to Cape Wrath - the most north-westerly point of the UK mainland - to visit his favourite beach, and learns how the area was once home to Britain's smallest school and why this wild landscape had to be abandoned. Ruth Goodman reveals how a Victorian craze for collecting ferns drove genteel women to extraordinary lengths on the perilous paths along the sea cliffs of Devon, while Adam McIntosh follows a secret underwater path off the isle of Iona in search of green marble.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Billy Connolly sets out to fill in the gaps in his own family history. Starting in Glasgow, the city of Billy's birth, he hopes to find out more about his mother's relatives. He believes they hailed from Ireland, but records concerning his great-great-grandmother only deepen the mystery. Billy also heads to India, where he unearths details of the parts two of his ancestors played in historical events.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit the village of Beadnell on the Northumbrian coast, where mysterious fragments of human bone have emerged over recent years. Legend ties the area to local seventh-century Saint Ebbe, and it is widely believed that a 13th-century chapel once stood here. As the diggers set out to investigate possible remains of an earlier structure on the site, they unearth some shocking finds.(n)

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.(n)

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.(n)

programme.title: UFOs Declassified
programme.desc: An investigation into the Roswell incident in 1947, when a UFO landed in the New Mexico desert. At the time, the US army claimed it had recovered a `flying saucer', but this was quickly retracted and the item was declared to be a humble weather balloon. Experts examine the evidence still available to try to reach a conclusive answer as to whether the crashed object was from Earth or another planet.(n)

programme.desc: Hanner canrif yn ol anfonwyd dau ffrind o Fethesda i ymladd yn Rhyfel Corea fel rhan o'u Gwasanaeth Cenedlaethol gyda'r Fyddin Brydeinig. Yn ddiweddar aeth y ddau yn ol i Gorea i ail-droedio'r hen lwybrau. Atgofion tra gwahanol o'r rhyfel sydd gan y ddau. Roedd John Davies yn filwr gyda'r Royal Artillery, a yrrwyd i ganol erchyllterau'r llinell flaen. Clerc yn yr Ordnance Corps yn prisio offer yn Siapan oedd Owen Williams trwy gydol y rhyfel. Ar ol blynyddoedd o rannu atgofion gyda'i ffrind, mae John yn mynd ag Owen yn ol i'r llinell flaen. Korean war veterans John Davies and Owen Williams take a tour of their old haunts, after years of reminiscing together made them realise how different their experiences were. programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the decaying body of an aspiring singer is found, Brennan and Booth's investigations lead them to a restaurant, where an open mic contest reveals several suspects. Crime drama, starring Emily Deschanel as a forensic anthropologist.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a human jawbone is discovered, it looks like the Gormogon serial killer has returned, and the evidence leads Brennan to a member of the Jeffersonian team. Crime drama, starring Emily Deschanel and David Boreanaz.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI team looks into the death of Cassie Flood, a journalist whose car careered off a winding mountain road. It looks like an accident at first, but Jane soon realises that foul play was involved and the investigation leads to billionaire philanthropist Tommy Volker - and Lisbon and Jane uncover evidence that Cassie was about to blow the whistle on his shady dealings. Guest starring Henry Ian Cusick (Lost).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: With the help of cult leader Bret Stiles (recurring guest star Malcolm McDowell), Patrick orchestrates an elaborate plan to break Lorelei Martins out of prison - making it look as if she kidnapped him before going on the run. While Lisbon and Homeland Security agent Robert Kirkland attempt to rescue Patrick, he tries to earn Lorelei's trust so that he can finally catch serial killer Red John. Starring Simon Baker, who also directs this episode.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. First lieutenant Michael Torres gets involved in a fight before falling to the ground, and is found beaten to death the next morning. The only witness is his friend and colleague Captain Joe Westcott, who suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder and has trouble distinguishing reality from his past military experiences in the Middle East.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Tony reviews satellite footage of rebel forces in the Middle East and spots Kersey among a group of insurgents, concluding that Joe Westcott's fear of him was well-founded. Back at HQ, Abby creates a 3D computer model of the attack that occurred in Afghanistan and Joe dons a virtual-reality headset to relive the traumatic events. Will it jog his memory?(n)

Crime drama, starring Emily Deschanel and David Boreanaz.(n)
