Elsewhere, Jane searches for leads on his new connection to serial killer Red John.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist

They discover that the victim was a botanist working on a new strain of marijuana resistant to fungal infection. programme.title: BB King - The Life of Riley
programme.desc: The American blues singer-songwriter recounts his story of a rise to prominence in the music industry, earning him the title `King of the Blues'. Born into a world of oppression in the cotton plantations outside Berclair, Mississippi, he went on to assemble his own band under the guidance of Millard Lee and found widespread popularity with his Singin' the Blues album in the Elvis-charged swinging zeitgeist of 1956. His talent showed no bounds, and more than half a century later he released his 42nd studio album, One Kind Favor, by which time he was well into his eighties - and showing no sign of giving up. Filmed in locations across the States, as well as the United Kingdom, and featuring contributions by a range of fellow musicians including Eric Clapton, Bono, George Benson and Mick Hucknall. Narrated by Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is stunned when Sheldon announces he is about to go on his first-ever date, and is even more surprised to find herself tagging along. Meanwhile, Leonard and Raj take a trip to the hospital after Howard's new robotic arm creates problems.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to extend his lifespan, concerned he will not be around long enough for his consciousness to be downloaded into a robot body, and the friends encounter Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak (guest starring as himself) at the Cheesecake Factory.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton challenges Matt Tebbutt to make crumpets, and finds out how the unique holes are created, while Jimmy Doherty looks into the unusually long shelf-life of baby food, and is introduced to a new machine that preserves food by using pressure instead of heat. In Italy, Matt discovers why mascarpone is more expensive than other soft cheeses.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: London-based couple Rena Sodhi and Donna Carty want a second home they can escape to in Mojacar, southern Spain. Laura Hamilton finds a townhouse with stunning views for £25,000 less than their budget, but the buyers spot something even more tempting in the presenter's line up of possible purchases.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Frankie and Gill Phibbs search for the home they have always dreamt of owning on Spain's Costa de la Luz. It has taken 20 years for the couple's plans to come to fruition and, having sold their family home in West Sussex and with a budget of £180,000, the pair are keen to seize the day and embark on their new life.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tim and Jules Anderson are first to host at the King's Head and Queen's Jules in Suffolk, where they provide their guests with a lesson in how to fillet fish, and an evening of karaoke. However, the owners find criticism hard to take the following morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gordon and Blossom welcome their rivals to the Hotel Continental in Harwich, Essex, where they are greeted by an erotic art display. The guests enjoy participating in a poetry reading during the afternoon, each writing their own piece, but the morning's breakfast goes awry after the hosts have a disagreement.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ryan Davies has to deal with a crisis when the contestants stay his five-star B&B Llanerch Vineyard in south Wales, but still manages to impress with his location and selection of wines. However, Gordon and Blossom go on a fault-finding mission and leave feedback the host is not happy with.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Neil and Tracy Bullows, owners of the Whitehall Hotel in Darwen, Lancashire, play host to the last night of the week's competition. Hoping to impress with a mix of professionalism and efficiency, they decide to take their guests on a tour of a local paint factory, but tempers fray and a stony silence follows at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Posh girl-about-town Liv Sargeant hosts the first party in Bath, and hopes to impress with her sophisticated evening, complete with black-tie dress code. However, her unusual choice of entertainment, and her undying love for Michael Buble, threaten to hamper her chances of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former raver Mel Lewis-Leger hosts the second dinner party in Bath, but her taste in music and a spicy Cajun menu prove off-putting for some of the guests. Meanwhile, cafe worker Becky Tyler becomes more sociable, until she decides to do an impression of one of her fellow diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Handyman Jon Wicheard hosts the third dinner party in Bath. Denis Verrier suspects the food will not be up to his exacting standards, and sandwich enthusiast Becky Tyler also doubts the meal will be a success. The prospect of a disco excites vegetarian and former raver Mel Lewis-Leger, but society girl Liv Sargeant dreads the thought of any form of forced entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cafe worker Becky Tyler hosts the fourth dinner-party challenge from Bath. The theme is a `Mad Hat' tea party, and she sets out to put on a menu of British classics, but the round of sandwiches for starters might prove too much for the diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Patriotic Frenchman Denis Verrier hosts the final dinner party in Bath, and hopes his experience of working in the hospitality industry will stand him in good stead. However, two of the guests are shocked by what they find in his wardrobe, and his staging of a penalty shoot-out provides more surprises, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Former pub landlady Janice Gibson wants to swap her Newcastle lifestyle for a new start in the Mar Menor area of southern Spain, so Laura Hamilton shows her a selection of properties starting from around £55,000.(n)

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A diving instructor looks for a change of career, a cottage accommodation business struggles to take off, and at the end of a tricky season an aerial yoga teacher ties the knot with her next door neighbour. However, as autumn approaches, have the Brits abroad managed to make their dreams a reality?(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Black rhino Kitani is due to give birth at Chester Zoo and help swell the ranks of this endangered species, but, having lost three previous calves, it is a worrying time and the keepers are concerned that things aren't going to plan. The zoo also has four rare new arrivals called tenrecs, mysterious mammals from Madagascar and, with so little known about them, the keepers try everything they can to help them breed, while red river hog Mali has given birth to twins, but tearaway dad Confetti is a threat to his own babies.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Commercial architect Martin Walker and his art-director wife Kae want to build the ultimate family home near York, inspired by a giant farm shed. However, her idea for a warm and cosy design conflicts dramatically with his penchant for building large square warehouses, and finding something they both agree on proves extremely challenging on their tight budget. Kevin McCloud follows the couple's progress.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three-year-old Louie is airlifted to St George's after being run over by a car while playing outside, with doctors expressing concern about his neck, which seems to be stuck in one position. Elsewhere, 14-year-old Josh is treated after injuring his ankle when riding a BMX with his father on the front. Meanwhile, 41-year-old Sam arrives in resus with a cut to her head and possible spinal and internal injuries after losing control of her car and crashing into a tree.(n)

programme.title: Rough Justice
programme.desc: As another link between the young female victims emerges, it appears the root of the problem is more precious than drugs, while Liese is forced to make a big decision. In Flemish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Seventy-nine-year-old Carole is brought in with signs of a stroke, and neurologist Dr Mahinda opts for a treatment that only has a slim chance of success. A 77-year-old man with diabetes has an infection in his toes, and doctors consider amputating his foot to stop it spreading. A woman's false eyelashes leave her with abrasions to her eyes.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Coastal enthusiast David Bull and countryside fan Kirsty Duffy advise Essex couple Jane and Gordon, who have £300,000 to spend on a property in East Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners gather for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Caroline and Stephen are keen to hear Stacey's reasons for not wanting to return to their `home-from-home' B&B, while Kevin wants to get to the bottom of why Ged and Suzanne gave him such low marks for cleanliness.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Simran Samra hosts the first party in east London, and decides to cook meat for her main course, despite being a vegetarian. The fashionista tries to salvage her chances of winning the £1,000 prize by performing a range of comedy accents after fellow competitor Alan Price upsets one of the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedian Yoshki Greenberg hosts the second dinner party in east London, but her decision to surprise the guests by asking them to wear animal-themed pyjama suits does not go down well - leaving her struggling to win them over with a stand-up routine.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alan Price hosts the third party in east London, and sets out to impress his fellow competitors with a medieval-themed dinner. He hopes to raise the standard of the contest with an ambitious menu, but stumbles at the first hurdle when vegetarian diner Simran Samra panics at the sight of his authentic pig's head as the table centrepiece. Things do not improve as the night goes on, with dirty dinner plates and sloppy hosting leaving the guests less than impressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bar owner Delia Elliot hosts the fourth dinner party from east London, and she is confident she can teach her young diners the protocol of entertaining guests. However, prankster Alan Price ends up having an argument with her, leading Simran Samra to take evasive action.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Doctor Chintu Gademsetty hosts the final dinner party in east London, and is confident of impressing his guests with a 1980s-themed evening. Even though his dance competition is not a hit with all of the diners, his food goes down a treat, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton meets retired couple Denise Grahame and Roger Denis, who met three years ago, and developed a shared love for Bretagne culture. Moving to Brittany, the pair took up residence in a rented property near the town of Callac, but are now seeking to buy a place of their own. Laura is tasked with seeking out suitable homes within their budget of £120,000, and picks out five rural abodes she believes might fit the bill.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps David Tomlinson and Andrea Metcalfe from Essex, who have decided that Spain's Costa de la Luz is the perfect place to buy a property.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Joe DiDomizio, CEO of travel retailer Hudson Group, goes undercover to ensure the company is fighting fit for the future. The businessman hopes to find that the company's vow to be `the traveller's best friend' is being upheld by his employees.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yanni's in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasn't allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peter's family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the coastal community of Long Beach, California, to save an Italian restaurant that was opened in 1958 and now under the misguided leadership of Nino, who blamed by brother Michael and sister Carina for the eatery's failings. Their 78-year-old mother Inge desperate for Nino to turn the business around, but the feuding family members will have to solve their differences first.(n)

programme.title: The £100k Drop
programme.desc: Sam and Shurma, a married couple from Whitley Bay, and mother and daughter Sarah and Hazel from Chigwell start off with £100,000 and must avoid wrong answers to maximise their win.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin put the five remaining teams to the test making layered slices. The first stage of the challenge involves making 24 tiramisu and 24 roulade praline slices in three and a half hours, while for the showpiece, they must prepare enough modern-themed croquembouches to serve 36 people.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of 5 Year Olds
programme.desc: The conclusion of a two-part special in which the children show what they know about right and wrong. Here they are given the chance to wield power, and new girl Sienna has a very clear idea of what being the boss means - although it remains to be seen how all the others react to her no-nonsense approach. Meanwhile, Luke and Ella are asked to take charge of three very excitable puppies, and when the children have the chance to vote on the best leader, who will triumph?(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: As Britain gears up for the royal wedding, the restaurant opens its doors to a new group of singletons hoping to find love like Harry and Meghan. History student Abbie is a descendant of Henry VIII but is hoping to find someone much nicer than her horrible ancestor. Butler Kit wants to meet a man who shares his passion for the royal family, and will football-mad James get the royal seal of approval from Kate Middleton lookalike Jodie?(n)

programme.desc: Up until the 1950s, food was a relatively simple matter, with narrow choice and a constant battle to keep food fresh. However, a sizeable proportion of food is now processed to maintain freshness, leading presenter Philip Boucher-Hayes to ask if people really know what they are eating. programme.desc: Steve, Sharpie and Andy take on Metcalfe's biggest ever job moving three massive oil rig sections. Simon and Paul bite off more than they can chew in a dockside move.(n)

programme.title: Ice Cold Gold
programme.desc: With time quickly running out for the miners, the physically and mentally drained group members search for rubies and sapphires.(n)

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike hunts down the cheapest Audi TT Quattro he can find, which is at the end of a 300-mile journey down to Cornwall, and later Edd tries to fix its gearbox.(n)

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike wants to splash the cash on a custom bus, but Edd favours a more conservative campervan due to him being an air-cooling expert.(n)

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini is asked to sell a collection of Boyd Coddington cars.(n)

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini has a 1931 Cadillac ready for auction, and is asked to restore the brakes on a re-creation of a 1937 Bugatti Atlantique.(n)

programme.title: How Things Work
programme.desc: The team delivers a comprehensive look at the inner-workings of objects including elevators, petrol pumps, an air-hockey table, a wood chipper, and dentists' drills.(n)

programme.title: Overhaulin' Chronicles
programme.desc: Chip and the A-team design and overhaul Roger Buchanan's '61 Impala Bubble Top.(n)

programme.title: Cycling: Giro d'Italia
programme.desc: Stage 13 from Ferrara to Nervesa Della Battaglia.(n)

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard scours sites around the UK for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.(n)

programme.title: Sinkholes: Swallowed Alive
programme.desc: The facts about the natural phenomena, which have made headlines as massive sinkholes have appeared at home and abroad, swallowing cars, buildings and, in one case, almost burying a woman alive when she fell down a hole in her garden. This documentary breaks down the science of these terrifying freaks of nature.(n)

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: Dave faces a disaster when he drills the wrong claim, and Parker is desperate to secure new ground. Meanwhile, the Dakota crew tries to protect its land from floods.(n)

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the classic Zenvo ST1, and conduct a in-depth analysis of the vehicle's luxury body-work.(n)

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew travels to the birthplace of the McLaren 650S, to reveal its inner workings and admire its attractive exterior.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the first of a three-part tale, Dave Quinnan volunteers to work with disaffected youths causing trouble on the Jasmine Allen estate, the scene of his stabbing. Hoping to lay a few ghosts to rest, he does his best to win the youngsters' trust - but Boulton threatens to jeopardise all his good work in pursuit of a suspected drug dealer. Andrew Paul stars.(n)

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The firefighters race against time and a tide of illegal diesel to save the victims of the road traffic accident. Hampered by erroneous information and inadequate equipment, the team struggles to release the injured and secure the area before lives are lost - including their own. Meanwhile, Pearce chooses Eve's godparents, and Melissa appears to get a lukewarm reaction to the news that she is leaving.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Feature-length episode in which the refurbished ED opens for the first time since the fire. The new facilities are put to the test when a traffic accident occurs on a nearby dual carriageway, and a pipe explosion causes a cloud of poisonous gas to engulf Holby. The staff are stretched to their limits despite the efforts of new paediatric doctor Tom Kent (Oliver Coleman), and as tempers fray, a patient lashes out at Dylan. Guest starring Marshall Lancaster (Ashes to Ashes) and Colin Buchanan (Dalziel & Pascoe).(n)

programme.title: Juliet Bravo
programme.desc: An 11-year-old girl caught pilfering from a launderette blames it on an imaginary friend.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Second of a three-part special. As events spiral out of control on the troubled estate, the police face an uphill struggle nailing the suspects. Quinnan has his own ideas on how to bring the dealers to justice, and a youth's disappearance forces him to disobey orders, risking his own life in the process. Andrew Paul stars.(n)

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer's daughter Vicki finds a ceremonial sword in the attic of her new flat that proves to have Scottish connections dating back to the era of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Lovejoy is approached by a man offering a generous sum for it, claiming a family connection. Later, after the item is subjected to a bungled burglary attempt investigations reveal it may hold the key to the location of buried treasure. Ian McShane stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. Meanwhile, Toby's attempt to regain Monica's affections is thwarted by a dog, and Marina decides to dress down for a change. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi
programme.desc: With no sign of Jeffrey Fairbrother, Ted is summoned to Head Office, and jumps to the conclusion that he is about to be made entertainments manager. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane.(n)

programme.title: Are You Being Served
programme.desc: In recognition of 20 years' service to the store, Captain Peacock is given the key to the executive washroom and a seat in the executive dining room - but the new privileges go to his head. Shop-floor comedy, starring John Inman, Mollie Sugden and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars.(n)

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A dawn raid by bailiffs leaves the antiques dealer staring ruin in the face, and with nothing left to look forward to, he decides to turn his back on society. With Ian McShane and guest star Alexei Sayle.(n)

programme.desc: The Fisher household acquires a new wireless receiver, while Dot realises that she doesn't want to relinquish working for Phryne when she marries. Australian crime drama, starring Essie Davis and Ashleigh Cummings.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest finds himself embroiled with MI5, which puts Lady Felicia in a compromising position - will she betray her friend to protect secrets from her own past? Drama, starring Mark Williams and Nancy Carroll.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A photo featuring a missing 19-year-old music student turns up in a charity shop donation bag on the anniversary of her disappearance 17 years earlier, prompting Sandra to suspect the work of a serial killer. However, as the team gets to work identifying and tracking down the other people in the picture, increasing pressure to hand over the investigation forces Sandra to consider her future, and she turns to a familiar face to help her make her decision. Amanda Redman stars, with Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey's kitchen goes up in smoke so Dorien, looking for an escape from visiting her mother-in-law, allows the sisters spend the weekend with her while the new kitchen is installed. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Dogs Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring animals doing bizarre and humorous things.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.sub-title: All's Fair in Love and War
programme.desc: Jill's competitive nature comes to the fore. Meanwhile, the mothers take Abby speed-dating in the hope the company of a good man will make her nicer to the girls.(n)

programme.title: According to Jim
programme.desc: Cheryl asks Jim to have a vasectomy, but he loses his nerve at the last minute and dare not go through with the procedure. Sitcom, starring James Belushi and Courtney Thorne-Smith.(n)

programme.title: According to Jim
programme.desc: Cheryl asks Jim to give up his vices before they try for a baby. James Belushi stars.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Kerry joins in the Great American Bake Sale and Bridget has to take care of a `flour baby' for a school assignment. Comedy, starring Amy Davidson.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: The Hennessys are invited to the wedding of their neighbours' daughter. Comedy, starring Katey Sagal and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Depressed, Stressed and Repossessed
programme.desc: Stories of people struggling on benefits. Mark from Cheltenham is a part-time drag queen who lost his Spanish bar after a licensing dispute. Now home and claiming sickness benefits for depression, he is keen to get well enough to work again. Plus, the stories of a widowed grandmother whose life has been tough since her drug-addicted grandson was sent to prison for attacking her, and a 63-year-old joiner who cannot work because of back trouble.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of a high-speed police interception unit in Essex. Officers chase a drug dealer on a motorway at night, a drink-driver endangers his life in a bid to avoid arrest and the team pursues one of the area's most wanted car thieves.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement agents Paul Bohill and Steve Pinner are in Birmingham on a potentially dangerous, full-scale eviction of a large traveller community. Meanwhile, in London's diamond district Brian O'Shaughnessy and Delroy Anglin are chasing nearly £6,000 owed by a jeweller to an unhappy customer, although a solicitor tries to convince Delroy his client owes nothing.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents chase more than £1,700 in unpaid parking fines in south-east London, but struggle to pinpoint the debtor. Meanwhile, officers in north Wales try to recover the £2,000 owed by a tradesman to a former employer, and in Kent agents chase £8,000 owed by a jewellery shop to two former employees.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Liam bids farewell to Jimmy, but Amy is left conflicted, while Yashvi is subjected to a racist slur from a football team-mate, but decides to keep quiet for fear of Dipi's reaction.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Confronted by the police with images of his past, Robbo finally regains his memory in its entirety, while the Morgans receive a ransom note demanding A$25,000 for Ava's return.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Vince's plans to move in with Will do not include Grace, who prepares to tell Leo she is pregnant with his baby. Meanwhile, Jack's new show makes its debut. Guest starring Josh Lucas, with Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: As the American sitcom draws to a close, there is more drama yet to come in the first episode of a two-part finale. Will and Grace decide whether to stay together, while Karen and Jack reach their own crossroads. Starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.sub-title: Sort of an Officer and a Gentleman - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Bridget begins to date Donny Doyle, the next-door neighbours' perfect son, but worries about committing to him with so much temptation around. Meanwhile, Paul invites Cate's sister Maggie to stay. Comedy, guest starring Cybill Shepherd.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.sub-title: Sort of an Officer and a Gentleman - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Bridget finds it difficult to stay faithful to Donny, and the relationship between Cate and her sister Maggie becomes increasingly strained. Paul discovers a pregnancy testing kit in the bin, and model student Kerry gets suspended from school.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Liam bids farewell to Jimmy, but Amy is left conflicted, while Yashvi is subjected to a racist slur from a football team-mate, but decides to keep quiet for fear of Dipi's reaction.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: The Morgans are divided over whether to pay the ransom or involve the police, while Ben puts family before work as Maggie and Ziggy face a daunting day at the hospital.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The Air Support Unit's helicopter is called into action late at night to look for an armed robber. On the ground, police pursue an escaped prisoner driving a stolen car down the wrong side of a dual carriageway and a van being driven erratically through the streets of Essex.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In Staffordshire agents try to collect nearly £2,500 in unpaid parking fines, while officers Matt and Garry head to the West Midlands to recover £4,500 owed from a debtor to his former girlfriend. Elsewhere, agents travel to south-east London looking to collect £3,000 owed by a taxi company.(n)

programme.title: Divergent
programme.desc: A teenager grows up in a strictly ordered future society where people's lives are decided according to personality types. She discovers she does not fit into any of the existing categories, and must fight against a conspiracy to wipe out all those like her. Sci-fi adventure based on the book series by Veronica Roth, starring Shailene Woodley and Kate Winslet.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Divergent
programme.desc: A teenager grows up in a strictly ordered future society where people's lives are decided according to personality types. She discovers she does not fit into any of the existing categories, and must fight against a conspiracy to wipe out all those like her. Sci-fi adventure based on the book series by Veronica Roth, starring Shailene Woodley and Kate Winslet.(n)

programme.title: Outbreak
programme.desc: An expert in infectious diseases races against time to find a cure for a rapidly fatal airborne virus which is wiping out the population of a small town, and is threatening to turn into a pandemic. However, his task is hampered by senior military men, who are bent on burning down the town and incinerating the virus with it, regardless of any casualties. Thriller, with Dustin Hoffman, Rene Russo, Morgan Freeman, Kevin Spacey and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The quarter-finals arrive, and only five contestants remain in the tent, and as the stakes get ever higher for the amateur bakers, Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins introduce yet another new Bake Off challenge - Tudor Week. All three tasks this week revolve around baking practices from the time of Henry VIII, beginning with a signature bake in the form of savoury-stuffed pies. In the technical heat, the contenders are asked to prepare unusual knotted Tudor biscuits, while the showstopper takes the form of a marzipan spectacle fit to grace a banquet tables at court. Plus, Sue Perkins visits Hampton Court to discover how a sweet delicacy nearly tempted the Virgin Queen Elizabeth I to marry.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Fish
programme.desc: Chef Keith Floyd demonstrates how to cook paella, before preparing crab and fishing for cockles in Weymouth. He also rustles up a fish soup during a trawler race in Plymouth.(n)

programme.title: Turkish Delights
programme.desc: Allegra McEvedy embarks on a culinary journey in Turkey. She begins by exploring the ancient spice market in Istanbul and learning about Turkish Delight.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finalists really have their imaginations put to the test this evening as John Torode and Gregg Wallace ask them to rustle up a dish using scraps, trimmings and leftovers. The ingredients include chicken giblets and skin, bones, pigs' ears, fish heads and bones, potato peelings and stale bread, so they need to use their ingenuity as well as their skill - and for one, it'll be the last dish they ever make on MasterChef. The rest are left to prepare a six-course menu for an esteemed group of experts who make their living analysing food and drink - so they won't be easy to please.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Real Food Show
programme.desc: The food writer rustles up an ice-cream sundae with chocolate sauce, along with a deep-fried ice-cream and mincemeat parcel.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Real Food Show
programme.desc: Chefs Alastair Little and Rowley Leigh prepare a roast chicken cooked with 40 cloves of garlic, while Nigella Lawson makes pea soup.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks chicken skewers with satay sauce, which he serves with a hot noodle salad, followed by fruit and mint sugar.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: The chef prepares a pizza, three salads and squashed cherries with vanilla mascarpone cream.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall concludes his trip by heading to the Lake District and Yorkshire in search of the finest northern tea experience. On his return to Dorset, he stops off in Birmingham, where he looks for the definitive recipe for curried goat. Back at base, he rustles up a Caribbean-flavoured feast for local lifeboat men, including salted pollock, rum cake and a beach bar of tropical drinks.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef journeys along the Etang de Thau, famous for its oysters and mussels, before mooring his barge in the port of Sete, where Bastille Day is being celebrated. He also rustles up seafood ragout and roast black bream before travelling on to Marseille to tackle the most famous fish dish of all - bouillabaisse.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. Arriving in Marseille, he samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as showing a variety of traditional recipes. He also cooks roast black bream and finds time to send Chalky a postcard.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Chicken and Egg
programme.desc: Dave and Si travel to Israel, where they visit the 2500-year-old remains of the world's first chicken farm, as well as getting a glimpse of the future for poultry. They prepare a shakshuka on a beach in Tel Aviv and chicken shawarma kebabs on the streets of Old Jerusalem. Finally, they make their own version of chicken schnitzel, a Middle Eastern dish with European roots.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Only four bakers remain as the semi-final arrives. This week, the contestants must demonstrate their mastery of patisserie in three more challenges. However, the stakes have never been higher, and a disaster in any one of the rounds might mean the difference between claiming a place in the final, or bowing out early. In the Signature, the bakers must achieve perfect lamination on French pastries, and in the Technical, Paul Hollywood puts the amateurs through their paces with a yeast-based cake with a fruity top and delicate chocolate work. For the Showstopper finale, the competitors face a multiple mini-cake bake, with Paul and fellow judge Mary Berry expecting a high-end finish that demonstrates the bakers' ability to manage their time.(n)

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks chicken skewers with satay sauce, which he serves with a hot noodle salad, followed by fruit and mint sugar.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: The American chef is joined by Michael Symon and the duo prepare a Greek menu including smoked pork ribs, tzatziki and spicy houmous.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: Anna Olson prepares a classic Blue Ribbon apple pie, and shares her recipe for a double crust pie dough.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates how to prepare ladyfingers - a part cake, part cookie dessert. She begins by making a simple version and then creates a chocolate alternative.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: The chef prepares shortbread cookies, beginning with a basic vanilla spritz shortbread made by piping cookie dough through a press.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna Olson's friends have harvested more vegetables than they can handle, so she shares recipes and tips on how best to preserve food.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares lunch for her family, including spicy sausage dogs with curry and onion sauce, kicking coleslaw with mustard and horseradish dressing, and kiwi lime pie.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes falafel with a chipotle tahini dip served in a pitta, chicken and waffles with maple syrup and Bourbon sauce, and a tart with a store-bought shortcut.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a care package to send to Alex, who is away at university, including brownie cookies, homemade cheddar crackers, spicy party mix and crazy chocolate bark.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: The Other Men In My Life
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is sharing about the other men in her life, like her dad, brother, brother-in-law and father-in-law, and their favourite sweets.(n)

programme.title: Valerie's Home Cooking
programme.desc: Valerie entertains her best friends at this month's meeting of their book club. Her menu includes a cream cheese crab spread with crostini, butter lettuce salad with hazelnuts.(n)

programme.title: Valerie's Home Cooking
programme.desc: After a morning spent at an adoption event for homeless animals, Valerie Bertinelli uses new and old family recipes to throw a sparkling cocktail party for her fellow volunteers.(n)

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, preparing smoked salmon with Yorkshire pudding, beets and asparagus, as well as cooking Greek chicken accompanied by sweet pepper and pea couscous with tzatziki.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, preparing glazed sizzling chops, and sweet tomato and asparagus lasagnetti. Plus, mushroom soup and stilton, apple and walnut croutes.(n)

programme.title: Valerie's Home Cooking
programme.desc: Valerie invites her family over for rugby, fun and lots of food, Cajun-style. She serves her quickest gumbo ever, alongside a fresh spring salad.(n)

programme.title: Valerie's Home Cooking
programme.sub-title: Grillin' And Chillin' With The Family
